chargeHist.descr: Criminal Damage to Property - Domestic Abuse Repeater

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Taron M. Randle

records.addlTxt: AMENDED: No contact with victim(s): A.H.F. Contact includes direct personal or physical and indirect contact by phone, in writing of any kind, entry to the person's residence or place of employment together with contacts through other persons.  Contact, however, may be made through the defendant's attorney. Police (Wausau P.D.) escort to retrieve personal property from the residence.   No Bars, Taverns, Liquor Stores or Beer Tents.  Absolute sobriety from and no possession of alcohol.  Report to ATTIC Corrections Services (715-848-3202) within one business day of release. Comply with pretrial monitoring through ATTIC Correctional Services at Level (4) supervision with possible drug testing as determined by agency screening. Defendant allowed to have electronic contact with ATTIC.

Clerk Marisa.
Case Called: 4:03 pm 
State appears by ADA Rory McGarry; Deft appears by Zoom Video with Atty Chad Shamali in person. 

BOND MODIFICATION HEARING. 
State objects to modifying bond and notes pre-trial supervision program is working with defts who reside out of county. 
Argument. 
COURT modifies level 4 supervision condition of bond to allow electronic contact with ATTIC. 

Atty Shamali requests substitution of judge. 
COURT refers matter to DCA for assignment of new judge. 
State notes pro se speedy trial demand and questions if time limits are tolled pending assignment of new judge. 
COURT advises time limits for speedy trial are tolled pending assignment of new judge. 
Adj: 4:08 pm
Request for Video Appearance - granted

Public Safety Assessment Report

No contact with victim(s): A.H.F. Contact includes direct personal or physical and indirect contact by phone, in writing of any kind, entry to the person's residence or place of employment together with contacts through other persons.  Contact, however, may be made through the defendant's attorney. Police (Wausau P.D.) escort to retrieve personal property from the residence.   No Bars, Taverns, Liquor Stores or Beer Tents.  Absolute sobriety from and no possession of alcohol.  Report to ATTIC Corrections Services (715-848-3202) within one business day of release. Comply with pretrial monitoring through ATTIC Correctional Services at Level (4) supervision with possible drug testing as determined by agency screening.

Clerk: Marisa; Case called: 2:16 pm 
State appears by ADA Rory McGarry; Defendant appears by Zoom Video from MCJ with Atty Paige Metzman. 
Reading Waived. 

Argument re: bond. 
COURT ORDERS: $2000 cash bond - CONDITIONS: 
- No contact with victim(s): AHF or her residence. 
- Police (Wausau PD) escort to retrieve personal property from the residence. 
- No Bars, Taverns, Liquor Stores, or Beer Tents. 
- Absolute sobriety from and no possession of alcohol. 
- Report to ATTIC Corrections Services within one business day of release. Comply with pretrial monitoring through ATTIC Correctional Services at Level (4) supervision with possible drug testing as determined by agency screening. 

@2:20 pm - Deft voluntarily removes himself from proceeding. 

BRANCH 3 CASE. 
RH: 2/4/2022 at 1pm in 101.  
Prelim: 2/9/2022 at 9:20 am in Br. 4.
